intent.feel: Classic, practical, “old-site” in the good sense: direct, readable, structured, not decorative.
intent.density: Information-dense, but always scannable via consistent hierarchy (headings, lists, predictable actions).
intent.decorations: Flat by default: borders + subtle tints. No “modern card UI” aesthetics.

principles.principle: Content and functionality first. Styling must increase clarity or speed of navigation.
Whitespace must justify itself (grouping, readability). Avoid empty bands.
Same thing must look the same everywhere (buttons, cards, lists, headings).
Color communicates meaning; avoid decorative color noise.
Shadows are basically off (only allowed if they communicate layering, e.g., dropdown over page).

h1.weight: Bold-ish (600–700). Must clearly read as a heading.

h4toH6.rule: Only for structure. Do not create special “styles” for small headings.

linkText.default: Looks like a link immediately (link color).

spacing.rule: Use a small fixed rhythm; avoid random one-off spacing.

borders.divider: Same as default border (do not vary thickness per component).
borders.metaBorder: 1px dotted using the “border” token color (only for meta bars).

corners.rule: Either none or minimal. Pick one and apply everywhere.
corners.recommended: Minimal rounding: 3px (use consistently for panels, cards, inputs, buttons).

shadows.exception: Only for layered UI (e.g., dropdown over page). If used: extremely subtle, same everywhere.

colors.rule: Use roles, not ad-hoc colors. Red is not a text paint; it’s an interaction/brand accent.

redUsageRules.rule: Never use brand red for long body text.
Headlines are not red (unless it is a clickable headline link, and even then keep it restrained).
Red is primarily for navigation and actions.

container.sidePadding: Small but present (enough to avoid edge collisions on mobile).
container.rule: All major sections align to the same container edges.

proseWidth.target: Comfortable reading width (roughly 45–60 characters per line).
proseWidth.rule: Text content is centered within prose width. Media may extend to container width.

looksLike.rule: All major homepage sections use the same H2 style.
Heading text is dark (headlines token), not red.
Spacing above a section heading is XL; below is L.
No decorative ornaments unless applied to every section heading (site-wide rule).
Flat box: 1px solid border, surface background.
Padding: L inside (dense but readable).
Radius: minimal and consistent (recommended 3px) or none everywhere.
No shadow.
Same as panel, but used in lists/grids.
Padding: L (or M for very dense widgets), consistent across all cards.
Title uses H3 sizing/weight rules.
Excerpt uses body text rules; keep visually consistent length in grids (line-clamp is allowed later).
Muted text (14px, line-height 1.4).
Top and bottom dotted lines (meta border style).
Padding top/bottom: about 10px; overall compact, not airy.
Always reads as a list (not a paragraph of links).
Each item has a consistent internal layout (title + optional meta + optional short line + action).
Use thin dividers between items when there are multiple items.
Item vertical spacing uses S or M; never random per list.
Looks like an action but stays lightweight (it is not a big button).
Uses link color; underline on hover/focus is mandatory.
Placement is consistent within cards/lists (typically bottom-left of the item).
Filled using brandRed, readable text contrast.
Height feels compact (roughly 36–40px).
Horizontal padding feels deliberate (roughly 12–14px).
Radius matches global corners rule.
Used sparingly (usually one primary per section).
Outline style: border + transparent/neutral background.
Same height and padding as primary.
Must not compete with primary; it is clearly the secondary choice.
Inputs are flat: border + surface background, minimal rounding.
Comfortable input height similar to buttons (36–40px).
Labels are clear and close to inputs (tight, structured, no large gaps).
Errors are explicit text + (optional) border change; do not rely on color alone.
Maps/embeds/images that need framing use the same border and radius as panels.
No special “photo frame” styling. Keep it utilitarian.

headerNav.rule: Header is compact: reduce vertical padding until it stops feeling “tall”.
Active/current nav item is obvious (one consistent treatment everywhere).
Nav links have enough horizontal padding to avoid misclicks.
Header uses brandRed; the rest of the page stays mostly neutral.

homepageNews.rule: Every post preview uses the Card recipe.
Post title is dark; action (“Weiterlesen”) is the colored interactive element.
Meta (date/author) uses MetaBar or at least meta text rules consistently.

eventsAndFeeds.rule: Events and external feeds are lists using the List recipe.
Each item: meta first, then title, then optional descriptor, then a text action.

footer.rule: Dense is allowed, but must be structured into clear blocks with consistent labels.
Footer links still look like links (same link rules).

definitionOfDone.check: Do all panels/cards share the exact same border, radius, and padding logic?
Are headings consistently dark, with red mainly reserved for nav/actions?
Does every list read as a list (not a wall of links/text)?
Is spacing following the rhythm (4 / 8 / 14 / 18 / 24–28), not random?
Are hover/focus states obvious and consistent for links/buttons?
